<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-CIG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/juul-agrees-pay-40-million-settle-north-carolina-vaping-case?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Juul Gets Vaporized
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/juul-agrees-pay-40-million-settle-north-carolina-vaping-case?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Juul logo" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTkyL2p1dWwuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a first-of-its-kind deal, e-cigarette company Juul agreed to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/28/health/juul-vaping-settlement-north-carolina.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pay $40 million</a> to North Carolina yesterday to settle allegations that its marketing efforts targeted teens. As part of the agreement, it will abandon any marketing content that appeals to young people and only sell its products behind-the-counter in the state. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>From startup rockstar to regulators' punching bag, Juul has been on a roller coaster ride these past few years. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The boom...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">E-cigarette use among teens shot up more than 70% after Juul's launch in 2015, and by 2019, more than a quarter of American teens tried vaping. Juul’s slick, flash-drive-like devices were so widely used in between chemistry and history class that they even became <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-29/is-juul-vaping-new-e-cigarette-survey-asks-teens-for-first-time?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a verb</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Altria, the tobacco giant that owns Marlboro, bought a 35% stake in Juul in 2018, Juul was valued at $38 billion. To put that number in context, Juul was worth more than Target, Lyft, and Airbnb. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The bust...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The same year, the FDA called teen vaping an “<a href="https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/statement-fda-commissioner-scott-gottlieb-md-new-steps-address-epidemic-youth-e-cigarette-use?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">epidemic</a>” and started to crack down on Juul and other e-cig companies. Although Juul insisted that its products were intended for adults, its marketing strategies said otherwise...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Juul released fruit-flavored pods that went viral among teens (it's pulled most flavors since).</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It recruited influencers with huge teen followings on social media to advertise the brand. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It plastered ads on homework solutions websites, so students solving for "x" would “accidentally” click on them. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facing suffocating regulatory challenges around its advertising strategy, Juul cut its <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-juul-valuation-idUKKBN27E3B8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">valuation</a> to about $10 billion in October 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>as of last summer, Juul was facing <a href="https://www.drugwatch.com/e-cigarettes/lawsuits/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">758 lawsuits</a> across the US. It’s also waiting for a ruling from the FDA about whether its products can remain on the market. That verdict is expected by September.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/facebook-hits-1-trillion-market-cap-ftc-complaint-dismissed?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook’s Double Bullseye
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/facebook-hits-1-trillion-market-cap-ftc-complaint-dismissed?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Zuck throwing a spear" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTk0L3p1Y2tfc3BlYXJfdGhyb3dpbmcucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Zuckerberg's FB page/Neal Freyman</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday was better for Facebook than when Brenda Song agreed to be in <em>The Social Network</em>. After a Washington, DC, federal court <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/technology/560578-court-dismisses-facebook-antitrust-challenges?rl=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dismissed</a> two antitrust cases against the company, it became the fifth US firm to reach a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/28/facebook-hits-trillion-dollar-market-cap-for-first-time.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1 trillion market capitalization</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> In December, the FTC and a group of attorneys general from 48 states and territories hit Facebook with two lawsuits, alleging the company has a monopoly over personal social networking after its purchases of WhatsApp and Instagram. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Judge James Boasberg did not think the FTC provided sufficient evidence to back up that argument. “It is almost as if the agency expects the court to simply nod to the conventional wisdom that Facebook is a monopolist,” he said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After the decision, Facebook shares gained 4.2% and it celebrated its grand entrance into the four-comma dollar club. The first US company to hit a $1 trillion valuation was Apple in 2018, and since then Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet have all joined.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>while this is a setback for regulators, Facebook isn’t in the clear yet. The FTC has until July 29 to file an amended complaint and yesterday, the House Judiciary Committee <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/24/technology/antitrust-overhaul-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> all six bills that would give US antitrust law its biggest makeover in decades.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/two-big-banks-announce-hybrid-work-schedules-amid-get-back-office-attitude-wall-street?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Some Banks Make Sweatpants and Slippers Official Dress Code
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Jamie Dimon is dusting off desks at JPMorgan, other banks are embracing the Zoom life. UBS, the Swiss lending giant, as well as Synchrony Financial, provider of Amazon and PayPal credit cards, both recently announced hybrid work plans that won’t require employees to stand on a sticky train five days a week.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>UBS </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/28/ubs-lets-two-thirds-of-staff-combine-working-from-home-with-the-office.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans</a></span><span> to let two-thirds of its staff work remotely several days a week.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Synchrony will </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-06-28/bank-bucks-u-s-peers-saying-no-one-should-return-5-days-a-week?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offer</a></span><span> three different office options: permanently remote for those who love their noon showers, satellite locations for employees to reserve desks ad hoc, or hybrid schedules with an assigned desk.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On Wall Street, that’s a narrative violation. </strong>In May, JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/jpmorgan-chase-goldman-sachs-big-banks-announce-plans-bring-back-staff-summer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> they would start bringing staff back this summer. And earlier this month, Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/16/investing/morgan-stanley-ceo-return-to-office/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> that if the company’s New York offices weren’t filled by Labor Day, “We’ll have to have a different kind of conversation.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Both UBS and Synchrony hope that offering flexible work schedules will help them retain and attract workers, which is necessary since <a href="https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/worklab/work-trend-index/hybrid-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">41% of employees</a> globally are considering leaving their current employer this year.</p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/key-performance-indicators-june-29?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Cooling off amid the heat wave in the northwest " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTg5L2Nvb2xpbmdfb2ZmX2FtaWRfdGhlX2hlYXRfd2F2ZV9pbl90aGVfbm9ydGh3ZXN0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nathan Howard/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Only 44% of homes in metro Seattle had air conditioning in 2019, the <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2021/06/25/seattle-portland-heatwave-pacific-northwest-dangerous/5354367001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest rate</a> of air-conditioned homes of any major American city, according to the US Census Bureau. We bring this up because the Pacific Northwest has been melting under an unheard-of heat wave. Temps in Seattle <a href="https://www.axios.com/pacific-northwest-heat-wave-hits-astonishing-peak-100d069f-0026-48f3-af29-744b50b60578.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">broke</a> their record by about 7°F yesterday, and Portland was 4° hotter than Atlanta's all-time high.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We were most heartbroken when we saw our dear General Secretary had become emaciated. Tears came out naturally.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A local resident interviewed by North Korean state TV was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kim-jong-un-lost-some-weightand-north-koreans-are-alarmed-11624884532?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">distressed</a> by images of leader Kim Jong Un’s significant weight loss. Analysts say the media campaign is choreographed to build sympathy for Kim as the country suffers from a worsening economic crisis.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kim’s health is closely watched by foreign powers, because he hasn’t appointed a successor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Why does it cost so much to build things in America? (<a href="https://www.vox.com/22534714/rail-roads-infrastructure-costs-america?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/mwc-returns-barcelona-oneyear-hiatus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
People Are Studying Abroad in Barcelona Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/28/mwc-returns-barcelona-oneyear-hiatus?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Woman trying a virtual reality headset " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NTg0L3dvbWFuX3RyeWluZ19hX3ZpcnR1YWxfcmVhbGl0eV9oZWFkc2V0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PAU BARRENA/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a sense. The people are attendees at the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the largest mobile industry trade show, which <a href="https://apnews.com/article/europe-health-coronavirus-pandemic-business-07fee8d8d00c32f35f22e6185a42165b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> in Barcelona yesterday after a one-year hiatus due to the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The line for coffee will be much shorter than usual. The show’s organizers are expecting 25,000–30,000 attendees from 143 countries, compared to the more than 100k visitors who have attended MWC in recent years. Lots of safety precautions are in place, including regular Covid tests, masks, and touchless everything.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A third of the MWC’s speakers, including Elon Musk, will give their talks virtually.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Barcelona hopes enough of those virtual attendees get FOMO and buy plane tickets for next year's show. In a non-Covid year, MWC generates $516 million and 14,000 part-time jobs for the local economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>CES, the US' giant consumer electronics show, will be held next January in a hybrid format—both in Las Vegas and digitally.</p>

As part of the agreement, it will abandon any marketing content that appeals to young people and only sell its products behind-the-counter in the state. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom startup rockstar to regulators' punching bag, Juul has been on a roller coaster ride these past few years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe boom...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eE-cigarette use among teens shot up more than 70% after Juul's launch in 2015, and by 2019, more than a quarter of American teens tried vaping. Juul’s slick, flash-drive-like devices were so widely used in between chemistry and history class that they even became \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-29/is-juul-vaping-new-e-cigarette-survey-asks-teens-for-first-time?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea verb\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Altria, the tobacco giant that owns Marlboro, bought a 35% stake in Juul in 2018, Juul was valued at $38 billion. To put that number in context, Juul was worth more than Target, Lyft, and Airbnb. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe bust...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe same year, the FDA called teen vaping an “\u003ca href=\"https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/statement-fda-commissioner-scott-gottlieb-md-new-steps-address-epidemic-youth-e-cigarette-use?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eepidemic\u003c/a\u003e” and started to crack down on Juul and other e-cig companies. Although Juul insisted that its products were intended for adults, its marketing strategies said otherwise...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJuul released fruit-flavored pods that went viral among teens (it's pulled most flavors since).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt recruited influencers with huge teen followings on social media to advertise the brand. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt plastered ads on homework solutions websites, so students solving for \"x\" would “accidentally” click on them. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacing suffocating regulatory challenges around its advertising strategy, Juul cut its \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-juul-valuation-idUKKBN27E3B8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evaluation\u003c/a\u003e to about $10 billion in October 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eas of last summer, Juul was facing \u003ca href=\"https://www.drugwatch.com/e-cigarettes/lawsuits/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e758 lawsuits\u003c/a\u003e across the US. It’s also waiting for a ruling from the FDA about whether its products can remain on the market. That verdict is expected by September.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday was better for Facebook than when Brenda Song agreed to be in \u003cem\u003eThe Social Network\u003c/em\u003e. After a Washington, DC, federal court \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/technology/560578-court-dismisses-facebook-antitrust-challenges?rl=1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edismissed\u003c/a\u003e two antitrust cases against the company, it became the fifth US firm to reach a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/28/facebook-hits-trillion-dollar-market-cap-for-first-time.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1 trillion market capitalization\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e In December, the FTC and a group of attorneys general from 48 states and territories hit Facebook with two lawsuits, alleging the company has a monopoly over personal social networking after its purchases of WhatsApp and Instagram. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJudge James Boasberg did not think the FTC provided sufficient evidence to back up that argument. “It is almost as if the agency expects the court to simply nod to the conventional wisdom that Facebook is a monopolist,” he said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter the decision, Facebook shares gained 4.2% and it celebrated its grand entrance into the four-comma dollar club. The first US company to hit a $1 trillion valuation was Apple in 2018, and since then Microsoft, Amazon, and Alphabet have all joined.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewhile this is a setback for regulators, Facebook isn’t in the clear yet. The FTC has until July 29 to file an amended complaint and yesterday, the House Judiciary Committee \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/24/technology/antitrust-overhaul-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e all six bills that would give US antitrust law its biggest makeover in decades.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS desk.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn Wall Street, that’s a href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/jpmorgan-chase-goldman-sachs-big-banks-announce-plans-bring-back-staff-summer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e that if the company’s New York offices weren’t style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Both UBS and Synchrony hope that offering flexible work schedules will help them retain and attract workers, which is necessary since \u003ca href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/worklab/work-trend-index/hybrid-work?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid The people are attendees at the Mobile World Congress (MWC), the largest mobile industry trade show, which \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/europe-health-coronavirus-pandemic-business-07fee8d8d00c32f35f22e6185a42165b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicked off\u003c/a\u003e in Barcelona yesterday after a one-year hiatus due to the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe line for coffee will be much shorter than usual. The show’s organizers are expecting 25,000–30,000 attendees from 143 countries, compared to the more than 100k visitors who have attended MWC in recent years. Lots of safety precautions are in place, including regular Covid tests, masks, and touchless everything.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA third of the MWC’s speakers, including Elon Musk, will give their talks virtually.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBarcelona hopes enough of those virtual attendees get FOMO and buy plane tickets for next year's show.
